name: Alexa Rodríguez Morales
description: Patient and family care must always be personalized and of the highest quality. A patient relationship is based on trust and honesty which is why one should always try to give a more human and sympathetic treatment.|As a child, I experienced my father’s suffering through illness up until his last days. This made me realize, not only that we need more well trained and committed medical specialists, but also that we need to be more empathetic and conscientious of our patients' pain and suffering. We need to understand our patients and be fully supportive at any time. I enjoy being an ENT because in most cases, I can give back health and comfort to my patients and their families.

name: Angie Mora Calderón
description: In pregnancy and birth communication is vital as well as in the management of gynecological problems. The prevention and treatment of cancer in an integral way is my priority.|Explanatory note: My profile and my name are being used to generate scams, I request precaution without being contacted by someone posing as me.|I studied medicine with the desire to help people and this is still my priority. From the field in which one works, one should always try to make every little thing the most important thing at all times, and try to do everything in the best way no matter what it is. Any issue that may be worrying one of my patients, I understand how important it is for her, and what she is going through on that particular time. |Maintaining a constant effort to improve and upgrade is an example instilled by my family and I stick to it in its entirety. name: David Martínez Tello
description: For me, the most important thing is that the patient, after talking to me, take clear and truthful information about the problem he has and the possible solutions that I as an orthopedist and surgeon can offer him.|I started my studies as a general practitioner without imagining that I would end up being an orthopedist. However, throughout my career I became passionate about this world in which we work with muscles, joints and bones with the aim of repairing or rebuilding something injured to promptly reincorporate the human being to an activity or sport; to bring him back into his life.|I completed my General Medicine studies at the Hispano-American University upon completion, completed my internship at the San Juan de Dios Hospital and later my Social Service at the Golfito Hospital (same place where I was born), later entered the Postgraduate Orthopedics and Traumatology from the University of Costa Rica rotating and performing my surgical practices at the Hospital México, Hospital San Juan de Dios and Hospital Nacional de Niños.| |During the last 3 months of specialty, I did a rotation in the Hip and Knee Joint Reconstruction Service at the Italian Hospital in Buenos Aires Argentina, this internship served as an orientation to later decide to carry out a subspecialty in Joint Surgery with the Autonomous University of Mexico at the National Institute of Rehabilitation in Mexico City, Federal District.|Currently I am dedicated to the management of musculoskeletal injuries caused by trauma, focusing mostly on joint preservation surgery as well as reconstruction in degenerative injuries.

name: Guillermo Guzmán Amaro
description: I truly believe that God chooses people to develop abilities and to specialize in areas with the purpose of helping others. We are instruments of God.|Since always, I wanted to be a surgeon. When I learned about surgical oncology, I saw it as challenge and opportunity to support people and to help separate the word “cancer” from “death”. What I like the most about being a surgical oncologist is that each patient is a new experience because every surgery is unique and different. Every patient has an opportunity to survive and it is my goal to help. As of 2013, I have more than 15 years of experience. I work full time at my Surgical Oncology private practice where we focus on: thyroid surgery, breast pathology, gastric cancer and colorectal cancer.

name: Linda Liu Lin
description: I believe in giving my best effort so my patients get better, sooner. I also believe in bringing understanding to my patients and accompanying them during the process.|I’ve always enjoyed having an impact on people and this is why I studied Medicine. During my internship at the Santa Cruz Hospital, I received a patient with an abortion who I had to refer out given that I wasn’t a gynecologist at the time. It was then when I decided to specialize in Gynecology and Obstetrics because it is a very versatile field which allows me to truly help women. It also gives me the opportunity of creating strong, long-lasting relationships with my patients while being able to be a part of their happiest moments in life, like pregnancy. What I enjoy the most about my work is being able to help with complicated cases that other Gynecologists won’t attend. Being able to help improve my patients’ quality of life when dealing with these complicated cases is why I sub-specialized in Gynecologic Urology.

name: Luis Daniel Quesada Mora
description: My personal belief is that God has gifted each and every one of us with different abilities and talents. It's essential to discover and develop these characteristics in order to fulfill the purpose for which we have been placed in this world. I decided to dedicate my career to reach that goal: to serve God and my fellow humanbeings|I believe that human beings are body, soul and spirit. Health is integral and depends on the wellness and balance of the three previously mentioned areas. Therefore, the challenge for health professionals is to understand this and to execute each professional act with a global perspective.|I am passionate about the digestive system because apart from its complex functioning in the process of feeding, digestion and absorption of food, it's the interface between our internal and the external environment, making it highly susceptible. In addition, it is the target of many of the emotional and affective disorders of the population and this makes the challenge even greater. This challenge motivates me to treat each patient as if it were the last I'll see in my life and enjoy the process as if it were the first one I attended in my career.

name: Luis Diego Carazo Fernández
description: Medicine is not a static science, it changes constantly; every day new things are discovered. My goal to give my patients the best possible care by keeping up-to-date, both in knowledge and technology, and by not omitting the human factor as I understand that each of my female patients have individual needs and should be treated as such. Over time, the comprehensive care I provide has naturally led me to becoming not only my patients’ gynecologist, but even more so, their friend.|Since I was in school I loved Medicine. I never had any doubt that this was my vocation and I continue to live deeply fulfilled with what I do. When treating a patient through pregnancy, I always act as if that baby was my child and I strive to the fullest with complete dedication so that everything goes well without taking unnecessary. What I like about Obstetrics is being able to work with life and not just disease. To attend a mother during the birth of her child is one of the most wonderful experiences that God gives us the opportunity to enjoy.
